Description: Part of a jar-seal of pale brown clay, bearing a seal impression of Peribsen and representation of Ash. The surface of the seal is worn but is otherwise in good condition.
Curator's comments: On the god Ash, see P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit II (Wiesbaden, 1964), 780-2, note 673. Bibliography: A. Roveri and F. Tiradritte [eds.], 'Kemet: Alle Sorgenti del Tempo' (Ravenna, 1998), p.250 [228-229]; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, 12, 53, pl.XXII, 178; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit III (Wiesbaden, 1964), pl.76, abb.283; see also vols. I, 154 and II, 843, n.908; 1130.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2003, Apr-Oct, Graz, Eggenberg Palace, 'The Tower of Babel'
